text:
Hi everyone, 
Does anyone know if there is a good way to redirect based on country? 
What I'm looking for is to redirect visitors from Sweden to .com/sv-se/ and visitors from Norway to .com/no/ and so on. 
Is there any good solutions to that problem?
Unless you can get the server admin to allow CORS requests from you, you will have to use JSONP or possible a backend server to reach out, may also help
If your questions is for one page then use A/B testing, else you can create redirect rules based on url pattern

This is for one page. If someone visits <http://example.com|example.com> and is visiting from an swedish IP adress I would like to redirect them to <http://example.com/sv-se/|example.com/sv-se/> and the same for Norwegian IP. And so on. 
So it is not an A/B test and I can not use the redirect function in HubSpot

<@U6GNQ7JBU> Thank you. Do you have an example of how it is used so that I can learn how I can use it? 
Thank you
as a heads up this doesnâ€™t appear to be documented in the hubl supported vars
You would probably also want to save a cookie or localstorage or something so that this only happens once per user per session, so if they want to opt in to another country's page they can.
Like if someone from Norway is browsing while visiting Sweden, they may want the Norwegian version of the site.
I've got a client coming up that wants something similar, so I've been thinking about this.

Thank you so much <@U3A4KEWK1> I'm still a bit new to coding and Did an elseif script but this is much better. 
Not really sure how to make the script that checks  `request.geoipCountry` 
My thought was to have <http://example.com|example.com> as a page with just the script and nothing more. and then direct them to the correct country page. 
the only trafic that comes to <http://example.com|example.com> is the direct trafic then you will be on the correct page and if you like to change to another language you have the option with the language switcher.

Running into an interesting issue using the slice filter and Am wondering if anyone has any thoughts on it.  So it is slicing in groups of 6 but turns out I have 13 but its filling in the extra set by printing the hubl variables
Anyway to get it to not fill in the extra 5 items
Was able to figure it out incase any one experiences this in the future. I just did an 	{% if item %} inside the 2nd loop and that did the trick
